page.title: 01THE CROWAN-RELEATH DISTRICT
page.content: This area is in West Cornwall and about twenty miles from Lands End. This area is not on the coast, it is inland. It is about 6 miles from the sea at any point. This area is between two towns, Camborne to the North and Helston to the South. There are many hamlets including Crowan, Releath and Burras. The land is mostly used for{farming}and growing crops. A large part is moor land, scattered with old mine works and shafts that are no longer used, but were once part of Cornwall's tin mining industry. The area enjoys a mild{climate. It is warmer and wetter than the rest of the country. The population is small and scattered around. It numbers approximately one thousand nine hundred and sixty.
